00067 class IdxSpec {
00068 
00069  private:
00070 
00075   int setndim(int n);
00076 
00079   int setndim(int n, intg *ldim, intg *lmod);
00080 
00082   int ndim;
00084   intg offset;
00086   intg *dim;
00088   intg *mod;
00089 
00097   intg resize(intg s0=-1, intg s1=-1, intg s2=-1, intg s3=-1,
00098               intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00099 
00100   template<typename SizeIter> intg resize( SizeIter& dimsBegin, SizeIter& dimsEnd ){
00101 
00102         const int nArgDims = std::distance(dimsBegin, dimsEnd);
00103 
00104         // Error-check the supplied number of dims.
00105         if( ndim == 0 ){
00106                 ylerror("Cannot call resize on a 0-dimensional IdxSpec.");
00107         }
00108         else if( ndim != nArgDims ){
00109                 std::ostringstream oss;
00110                 oss<<"Number of supplied dimension sizes ("<<nArgDims<<") doesn't match IdxSpec's number of dims ("<<ndim<<")";
00111                 ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00112         }
00113 
00114         // copy dimensions to dim
00115         std::copy(dimsBegin, dimsEnd, dim);
00116 
00117         // set mod to be the partial sum of the dim sequence, in reverse order.
00118         typedef std::reverse_iterator<SizeIter> RIter;
00119         typedef std::reverse_iterator<intg*> RintgIter;
00120         std::partial_sum( RIter(dimsEnd-1),
00121                                           RIter(dimsBegin-1),
00122                                           RintgIter(mod+(nArgDims-1)),
00123                                           std::multiplies<intg>() );
00124 
00125         // return the memory footprint
00126         return mod[0] * dim[0] + offset;
00127   }
00128 
00130   intg setoffset(intg o) { return offset = o; }
00131 
00132  public:
00133 
00135   ~IdxSpec();
00136 
00138   const IdxSpec& operator=( const IdxSpec& src);
00139 
00141   void copy( const IdxSpec& src);
00142 
00144   IdxSpec( const IdxSpec& src);
00145 
00148   IdxSpec();
00149 
00151   IdxSpec(intg o);
00152 
00154   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0);
00155 
00157   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0, intg size1);
00158 
00160   IdxSpec(intg o, intg size0, intg size1, intg size2);
00161 
00163   IdxSpec(intg o, intg s0, intg s1, intg s2, intg s3,
00164           intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00165 
00168   IdxSpec(intg o, int n, intg *ldim, intg *lmod);
00169 
00171   intg getoffset() { return offset; }
00172 
00174   int getndim() { return ndim; }
00175 
00179   intg footprint()  {
00180     intg r = offset + 1;
00181     for(int i=0; i<ndim; i++){ r += mod[i]*(dim[i]-1); }
00182     return r;
00183   }
00184 
00186   intg nelements() {
00187     intg r = 1;
00188     for(int i=0; i<ndim; i++){ r *= dim[i]; }
00189     return r;
00190   }
00191 
00195   bool contiguousp() {
00196     intg size = 1; bool r = true;
00197     for(int i=ndim-1; i>=0; i--){
00198       if (size != mod[i]) r = false;
00199       size *= dim[i];
00200     }
00201     return r;
00202   }
00203

00375   // TODO: Find out why code such as Idx<float> = 1 compiles
00376   // (even without default operator below).
00377   // default operator below outputs an error that this is forbidden.
00378   virtual Idx<T>& operator=(T other){
00379         ylerror("Forbidden Idx assignment. Idx can only be assigned another Idx.");
00380         return *this;
00381   }
00382 
00383   virtual Idx<T>& operator=(const Idx<T>& other) {
00384         Srg<T> *tmp = NULL;
00385         if (this->storage != NULL)
00386                 tmp = this->storage;
00387           this->storage = other.storage;
00388           this->spec = other.spec;
00389           this->storage->lock();
00390           if (tmp)
00391                 tmp->unlock();
00392           return *this;
00393   }
00394 
00395   virtual Idx<T> operator[](const intg i) {
00396           return this->select(0,i);
00397   }
00398 
00400   // Keep this 'explicit' until we decide to implement operator=.
00401   //Idx( Idx<T>& other );
00402   //Idx( const Idx<T>& other );

00425           storage->lock();
00426   }

00464   virtual void resize_chunk(intg s_chunk, intg s0=-1, intg s1=-1, intg s2=-1, intg s3=-1,
00465               intg s4=-1, intg s5=-1, intg s6=-1, intg s7=-1);
00472   template<typename SizeIter>
00473   void resize( SizeIter& sizesBegin, SizeIter& sizesEnd ){
00474                 const int ndims = std::distance( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00475                 if ( ndims > MAXDIMS ){
00476                         std::ostringstream oss;
00477                         oss<<"Number of dimensions ("<<ndims<<") exceeds MAX_DIMS ("<<MAXDIMS<<")";
00478                         ylerror(oss.str().c_str());
00479                 }
00480 
00481                 std::vector<T> sizes(ndims+1);
00482                 std::copy(sizesBegin, sizesEnd, sizes.begin());
00483                 sizes.back() = -1;
00484                 spec.resize( sizesBegin, sizesEnd );
00485                 growstorage();
00486   }

00663 // Idx Iterators: gives you a pointer to the actual data,
00664 // unlike IdxLooper which gives you another Idx.
00665 
00680 template <class T> class IdxIter {
00681 
00682  public:
00684   T *data;
00686   intg i;
00688   intg n;
00690   int j;
00692   intg d[MAXDIMS];
00694   Idx<T> *iterand;
00695 
00697   IdxIter();
00698 
00701   T *init(Idx<T> &idx);
00702 
00704   bool notdone();
00705 
00707   T *next();
00708 
00710   T& operator*() { return *data; }
00711 
00712 };
